zone.line: wanderings.
I lay upon the grass surrounded
by a darkness which not the slightest
beam of light penetrated – There
was no sound for the deep night
had laid to sleep the insects, the
only creatures that lived on the
lone spot where no tree or shrub
could afford shelter to ay aught else –
There was a wondrous silence in
the air that calmed my senses
yet which enlivened my soul,
my soul ^mind hurried from image to
image and seemed to grasp an
eternity of time All in my heart
was shadowy yet calm, untill my
ideas became confused and at length
died away in sleep.
When I awoke it rained: I was
already quite wet, and my limbs were
stiff still and my head giddy with the chill
of night. It was a drizzling, penetrating
stiff chill
